curator_overview: RV and trailer parking options near Wellington International for riders and families hauling in. Focused on practical details like hookups, late-night arrivals, and proximity to the showgrounds.
curator_cta_text: Reserve RV space early—hookups sell out quickly for WEF season.

on_site.description: RV spaces or hookups offered directly on venue grounds.

spots.rvpark_hours_note: Check-in after 12 p.m., late-night arrival allowed with gate code
spots.rvpark_overview: Limited hookups directly on the showgrounds for trainers, riders, and support staff needing the shortest commute.
spots.rvpark_spotlight: Closest possible RV option—walkable to stabling, vendor row, and jog strip.
spots.rvpark_cta_text: Book directly through the show office to secure one of the limited hookups.
pro_tips: Confirm gate code before late-night arrival after shipping horses.
Book months ahead—spaces are gone before January.

nearby_short_drive.description: Private or public RV parks within 15 minutes of the venue.

spots.rvpark_overview: Family-friendly park with shaded pull-through sites and easy highway access.
spots.rvpark_spotlight: Good balance of commute time and amenities for week-to-week stays.
spots.rvpark_cta_text: Check availability early—fills fast during WEF.
pro_tips: Check if they allow horse trailers—some parks restrict commercial rigs.
Bring a surge protector for hookups; older systems can spike.

wider_area.description: Options within 30–45 minutes for longer stays or budget-conscious rigs.

spots.formatted_address: 2000 Lion Country Safari Rd, Loxahatchee, FL 33470
spots.rvpark_hours_note: Office closes at 6 p.m., call ahead for late arrival instructions.
spots.rvpark_overview: Large KOA with family activities and full amenities, about 30 minutes from the showgrounds.
spots.rvpark_spotlight: Better availability during peak WEF weeks, great for long-term stays.
spots.rvpark_cta_text: Reserve weekly or monthly for best pricing.
pro_tips: Expect longer commutes—plan buffer time for morning schooling trips.
Use the park’s laundry facilities for show coats and saddle pads.
